It is located in Paris in the district of Belleville-Menilmontant.
Space in Progress was started in 2015 by Maria Ibanez Lago Constanza Piaggio artists. This project works on the creation and dissemination of contemporary art projects collectively and individual character. It seeks to give rise to projects of Argentine and international emerging artists by creating platforms for exchange and visibility of the places for artists working in different contexts. It is in the tradition of independent projects from the artists' initiative by offering experimental instances in the context of contemporary art.
S.I.P mainly focuses on these three proposals:
Julio (artsit-run space), Outer space, projects organized by Space in Progress can operate with variable geometry and occur in various reception areas and finally, Tea W.I.P. (Tea work in progress), a platform for exchange between artists in the form of monthly meetings where everyone can present his own work. It is open to artists, without excluding other actors of contemporary art and researchers from other disciplines. It uses the modality of presentations followed by open comments to the audience.

The Mosquito Coast Factory est un atelier implanté au cœur d'une Zone d'Aménagement Concerté située entre Nantes et Saint-Nazaire.La conception de sa forme architecturale est le fruit d'une collaboration entre l'artiste Benoît-Marie Moriceau et l'architecte Gaston Tolila. L'accès au bâtiment se fait par un portail monumental qui, une fois clos, devient quasi imperceptible, formant un large cube bardé de métal et dépourvu d'ouvertures. L'ensemble de l'atelier baigne dans une lumière équilibrée grâce l'utilisation du polycarbonate translucide utilisé pour la façade nord et le cloisonnement intérieur. Structuré selon une trame systématique, l'espace intérieur obéit à une logique de symétrie dessinée par la charpente en acier galvanisé. La nef est un espace central tout en hauteur réservé à l'assemblage de pièces de grande échelle, tandis que les deux bas-côtés sont destinés à la production et au stockage des œuvres. Les deux tribunes supérieures, desservies par des escaliers collatéraux, abritent quant à elles un espace d'accrochage, un bureau d'études et un studio d'habitation.Selon les nécessités de production et la nature des projets, cette logique de construction autorise un usage flexible et un aménagement modulable. L'aspect brut des matériaux utilisés (béton, métal, plastique et néons) s'inspire directement des édifices industriels. De plus, l'aspect extérieur volontairement épuré et monolithique rappelle le caractère impersonnel et mystérieux de certaines usines, car rien ne nous indique a priori la destination de ce bâtiment.L'atelier Mosquito Coast se réfère également à une architecture fictive tirée du roman éponyme de Paul Theroux (1981), porté à l'écran cinq ans plus tard par Peter Weir. L'histoire met en scène un inventeur fou qui quitte les Etats-Unis pour le Honduras dans le but de fonder une société utopique. Il débarque avec toute sa famille " au royaume des moustiques ", et construit au cœur de la jungle un bloc de métal qui abrite une vaste fabrique de glaçons censée révolutionner le mode de vie de la population indigène. Cet élément de décor, espace de projection d'une pensée créative et d'un fantasme de société nouvelle, devient ici la source d'une interprétation architecturale, support et outil potentiels d'histoires et d'imaginaires.
presentation_en: The Mosquito Coast Factory is a studio located in the heart of a Concerted Development Zone located between Nantes and Saint-Nazaire.La design of its architectural form is the result of collaboration between the artist Benoît-Marie Moriceau and architect Gaston Tolila. Access to the building is through a monumental gate that once closed, is almost imperceptible, forming a large cube of metal encased and no openings. The entire workshop is bathed in light through a balanced use of translucent polycarbonate used for the north facade and interior partitions. Structured according to a systematic frame, the inner space obeys a logic of symmetry drawn by the framework of galvanized steel. The nave is a central space while height reserved for the assembly of large-scale parts, while the two aisles are intended for the production and storage of works. The two upper galleries, served by collateral stairs, they are home on a hanging space, a design office and a studio habitation.Selon production needs and the nature of the projects, this logical construction allows a flexible use and a modular design. The gross appearance of the materials used (concrete, metal, plastic and neon) is directly inspired by industrial buildings. Additionally, voluntarily uncluttered appearance and monolithic reminds impersonal and mysterious nature of certain plants, for nothing a priori indicates the destination of this bâtiment.L'atelier Mosquito Coast also refers to a fictional architecture drawn from the eponymous novel Paul Theroux (1981), brought to the screen five years later by Peter Weir. The story features a mad inventor who leaves the United States for Honduras in order to found a utopian society. He arrived with his family "in the realm of mosquitoes," and built in the heart of the jungle a metal block which houses a vast ice maker supposed to revolutionize the way of life of the indigenous population. This decorative element, projection space for creative thinking and a new society of fantasy, here becomes the source of an architectural interpretation, tool support and potential stories and imaginary.

presentation: flip is a platform to expand on various interests in relation to current culture and artistic practice. the projects are the result of our international network and multidisciplinary collaborations. Continuous shifts in context invite inputs and spontaneous occurrences that contribute to the multi-layed and transnational discourse that characterizes flip.The locationThe last floor of the 1690 palazzo ruffo di castelcicala in the centre of napoli, forms the base location for flip.flip is a vision and a project in itself, not specific to a site, but rather an evolving network of activities and locales.

Tripode invite des artistes dont la pratique relève majoritairement du champ des arts visuels et produit des expositions monographiques en général, en duo parfois, plus rarement collectives, dans le domaine de l'art contemporain. Dans les premiers locaux de l’association en 2002 ont pris place deux programmes d’expositions, Exhausteur de goût et Interdit au public où 25 expositions se sont succédées en épisodes. Depuis 2005, le programme Suggestion de présentation propose de nouveaux épisodes. Installée dans un cadre extrêmement typé — 200 m2 insérés dans le grand cube noir basculé signé Massimiliano Fuksas — la galerie développe naturellement un goût marqué pour l’expérimentation et la réflexion sur le format d’exposition. La saison 2013-2014 prolonge cet esprit de laboratoire, de l’expérience de l’oeuvre.
presentation_en: Tripod invites artists whose practice primarily falls within the field of visual arts and produced solo exhibitions in general, duo sometimes, rarely collective, in the field of contemporary art. In the first premises of the 2002 Association took up two exhibition programs, taste enhancer and prohibited the public where 25 exhibitions have succeeded in episodes. Since 2005, the Serving suggestion program offers new episodes. Set in a very typical part - 200 m2 inserted in big black cube tilted signed Massimiliano Fuksas - gallery naturally develops a taste for experimentation and reflection on the exhibition format. The 2013-2014 season continues this spirit of laboratory experience of the work.

presentation: Mars ouvre à Milan le 3 Décembre 2008. C'est un espace géré par des artistes et destinés à un public curieux de connaître plus intimement l'art contemporains. L'espace Pasteur est né d'une idée originale de Lorenza Boisi et a été initié avec la complicité d' autres artistes un programme pour Mars, fait d'événements de performance, exposition et art, sur le modèle auto-géré.Au fil des ans au projet MARS, ont participé : Alessandro Roma, Andrea Dojmi, Antonio Barletta, Dacia Manto, David Casini, Ivan Malerba, Jacopo Miliani, Laura Pugno, Laura Santamaria, Lidia SANVITO, Lorenza Boisi, Luca Bertolo, Luca Trevisani, Luigi Presicce, Manuele Cerutti, Nicola Gobbetto, Paul Gonzato, Sergio Bréviaire, Simone Tosca, Stefano Mandracchia, Lucia Leuci, Nicholas Genovese.
presentation_en: March opens in Milan on December 3, 2008. It is a space run by artists and for a curious public to know more intimately contemporary art. The Pasteur space is born from an original idea by Lorenza Boisi and was initiated with the help of other artists a program for March, due to performance events, exhibition and art, the self-géré.Au wire model the years to the MARS project, participated Alessandro Roma, Andrea Dojmi Antonio Barletta, Dacia Manto, David Casini Ivan Malerba, Jacopo Miliani, Laura Pugno, Laura Santamaria, Lidia SANVITO Lorenza Boisi Luca Bertolo Luca Trevisani, Luigi Presicce Manuele Cerutti Nicola Gobbetto Paul Gonzato Sergio Breviary, Simone Tosca Mandracchia Stefano, Lucia Leuci Nicholas Genovese.

presentation: 63rd - 77th STEPS is a project space founded and run by the artist Fabio Santacroce. The name refers to the final part of a multi-floor staircase (the area between 63 ° and 77 ° step), inside a building from the beginning of the XX century in Bari.Site-specific exhibitions are alternated with off-site and online exhibitions meant as physical and metaphorical extensions of this residual place. 63rd-77th STEPS strains and investigates the limits and potentialities of the periphery, redefining its spatial and temporal framework.

TARS est un Artist Run Space qui organise des expositions ( Solo ou Group shows ), l'espace propose une résidence d’artiste pour favoriser les échanges et le dialogue, entre différentes structures ( résidences/galeries ) et cultures différentes.Chaque exposition fonctionne comme une vitrine pour le public ThaÏlandais, agissant sur des scènes artistiques hors territoire, mais aussi comme une plateforme de soutien pour les artistes résidents en Thaïlande ( où il est difficile de s’affirmer de manière locale, surtout lorsque les gouvernements et pressions changent constamment ).
Avec notre réseau et l’usage intensif du web, TARS tente de promouvoir la scène contemporaine présente ici et son hybridation suite au divers dialogues générés lors des expositions.Il a récemment été crée un programme appelé TAIGERS, qui vise à produire / promouvoir /et organiser des expositions, pour les jeunes diplômés des différentes Ecoles d’art sur Bangkok ( 5 sur Bangkok ).
presentation_en:
TARS is an Artist Run Space which organizes exhibitions (solo or group shows), the space offers an artist residency to foster exchanges and dialogue between different structures (homes / galleries) and différentes.Chaque exhibition functions as crops a showcase for the Thai public, acting on artistic outside the territory, but also as a support platform for resident artists in Thailand (where it is difficult to assert themselves locally, especially when governments and constantly changing pressures) .
With our network and web intensive use, TARS trying to promote the contemporary scene presents here and hybridization following the various dialogues generated during expositions.Il has recently created a program called TAIGERS, which aims to produce / promote / and organizing exhibitions for young graduates from different art schools in Bangkok (Bangkok 5).

presentation: CONA is an artists-run initiative that aims at creating an avenue for students, artists, designers, and professionals from different fields to come together. It intends to function as an ongoing mind space, a point of contact that shall kindle ideas, facilitate discourse, stimulating both thought and action. In a word, here is an adda for ideas, perspectives, happenings and people to meet, where they can work, think, participate in activities and projects that encompass disciplines, genres, times and lives Cona will work with the active and contributive involvement of every visitor participator. We intend to build a digital archive, a resource that can be accessed by all. For this we encourage all to volunteer, share and contribute in any form of data, footage, images, audio or other. A further extension of this archive would be collective engagements in the form of screenings or talks.Cona also offers part of the space as a venue for artist residencies and will also initiate a design centre.Our intention: neither to act as an exhibition space nor just a digital archive, but to be an active catalyst in a continuous situation where thoughts and experiences can be shared and can grow

The Lab believes that if we give artists enough time, space, and funding to realize their vision, the work they produce will change the way we experience the world. These are often small propositions that (like all great art) challenge the familiar ways we perceive value, and so we seek out extraordinary artists who are underrepresented as a result of gender, class, race, sexuality, or geography, and whose work is not easily defined and therefore monetized. As a site of constant iteration and indeterminacy, The Lab is, above all, a catalyst for artistic experimentation.
The Lab is W.A.G.E. Certified. W.A.G.E. Certification is a program initiated and operated by working artists that publicly recognizes non-profit arts organizations demonstrating a commitment to voluntarily paying artist fees that meet a minimum standard.
The Lab is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, federal ID number 94-2952488.
We are not accepting artist submissions at this time.
Our space is wheelchair accessible and is located 1/2 block from the 16th and Mission BART.
Please check our program calendar for hours.

Les Limbes est un espace de diffusion et de promotion des arts plastiques actuels et contemporains, géré par l’association céphalopode. Il se veut comme un espace d’échange sur des questions contemporaines, un laboratoire d’expérimentation pluridisciplinaire.Depuis 2012 il ne cesse de s’affiner dans sa programmation et dans ses objectifs.Aujourd’hui il compte trois niveaux d’investissements différents : des expositions d’artistes et jeune création, monographiques ou collectives ; 2. des workshops ; 3. des évènements thématiques ; et bientôt : des conférences, des résidences, des micros éditions.
Les Limbes dispose d’un espace de 60 m² situé en centre ville.
Nous étudions toutes propositions, rencontres, partenariats.
presentation_en:
Limbo is a space for dissemination and promotion of current contemporary art and run by the cephalopod association. It is intended as a space for exchange on contemporary issues, an experimental laboratory pluridisciplinaire.Depuis 2012 he continues to refine its programming and its objectifs.Aujourd'hui it has three different levels of investment: artists Exhibition and young artists, solo or group; 2. workshops; 3. thematic events; and soon: conferences, residencies, publications microphones.
Limbo has a space of 60 sqm located downtown.
We study all proposals, meetings and partnerships.

presentation:
Enterprise Projects is an Athens based project by Danai Giannoglou and Vasilis Papageorgiou. Created out of our need to express and share our point of view concerning the contemporary artistic creation,this venture aims at experimenting and conversing; experimenting with the curatorial proposal, artistic creation, self-organized function, and conversing with the artistic scene, the Athenian audience and the place itself, which houses the project.
As a structure Enterprise Projects has been functioning independently and periodically since September 2015 in Ampelokipoi, Athens.

TRIPLA, artist run space active since 2016 in Bologna, via Indipendenza 71 f, Italy. Our space is composed of three showcases of a former shop, observable only from the outside 24/7 all year. During this year we hosted happenings, solo and collective shows by artists from Italy, Switzerland and Germany.

Clovis XV est un espace dédié à l’art contemporain, ouvert en novembre 2014 à Bruxelles par les membres du collectif IDIOM et dirigé aujourd'hui par par Anastasia Bay et Julien Saudubray.Le lieu curate ou donne carte blanche à des artistes et commissaires d’expositions au travers de nombreuses propositions présentant la jeune création dans des expositions individuelles ou collectives.
presentation_en: Clovis XV is a space dedicated to contemporary art, opened in November 2014 in Brussels by members of the collective Idiom and led today by Anastasia Bay and Julien Saudubray.Le place curate or gives carte blanche to artists and commissioners exhibitions through numerous proposals presenting young artists in solo and group exhibitions.

presentation: L’oeil de boeuf est une association qui ouverte à Lyon depuis avril 2010.Son activité s’articule autour de la production, l’exposition et de la diffusion d’art. C’estun lieu d’échange qui a pour but l’accueil, l’ouverture au dialogue et aux propositionsd’artistes.L’association l’oeil de boeuf ouvre ses portes aux jeunes artistes en leur proposant unespace dédié à l’exposition. Chaque vernissage est animé par une performance sonore.
presentation_en: The bull's-eye is an association open to Lyon since April 2010.Son activity revolves around the production, exhibition and dissemination of art. This isa place of exchange which aims hospitality, openness to dialogue and propositionsd'artistes.L'association the bull's-eye opens its doors to young artists by offering unespace dedicated to the exhibition. Each opening is driven by a sound performance.

presentation: Le centre d’artistes montréalais TOPO est un laboratoire d’écritures et de créations numériques pour les espaces du web, de la performance et de l’installation. Son mandat est d’incuber, de produire et de diffuser des œuvres multimédias originales qui explorent les croisements interdisciplinaires et interculturels à travers les arts numériques.
presentation_en: The center of Montreal artists TOPO is a laboratory of writings and digital creations for web spaces, performance and installation. Its mandate is to incubate, produce and distribute original multimedia works that explore the interdisciplinary and intercultural intersections through the digital arts.

presentation: Ouvert en septembre 2015, le SHED est un centre d’art contemporain indépendant. Situé près de Rouen (à 1h30 de Paris et quelques minutes de Mont-Saint-Aignan). Installé dans une ancienne usine de mèches de bougie, typique des bâtiments industriels du 19e siècle, le SHED offre 600 m2 d’espace d’exposition. L’ampleur du lieu tient à l’architecture même des usines construites à cette période : plan libre, structure poteau-poutre en fonte, hauteur sous plafond (4 mètres sous poutre, 6,5 mètres sous faîtière). Ce volume est exceptionnel dans notre région, aucun lieu d’exposition en Normandie n’offrant de tels espaces. Il permet d’envisager la présentation de pièces de grande dimension.
presentation_en: Opened in September 2015, the SHED is an independent contemporary art center. Located near Rouen (1h30 from Paris and minutes from Mont-Saint-Aignan). Housed in a former factory in candle wicks, typical of industrial buildings of the 19th century, the SHED offers 600 m2 of exhibition space. The scale of the place due to the architecture of plants built in this period: free plan, beam-column cast iron structure, high ceilings (4 meters in beam, 6.5 meters under umbrella). This volume is unique in our region, no venue in Normandy not offering such spaces. It allows to consider the presentation of large workpieces.

presentation: Arprim, centre d'essai en art imprimé a pour mission de diffuser les pratiques actuelles liées aux arts imprimés.Il aborde l’imprimé comme un média ouvert, mobile, social et accessible. Il se définit comme un espace d’essai et d’expérience propice au développement d’une vision pluraliste de l’art imprimé. En tant que diffuseur de l’art actuel, Arprim se propose d’agir comme intermédiaire privilégié entre les artistes et le public et de faciliter le contact avec les pratiques émergentes liées aux arts imprimés. Misant sur le partage des idées et sur la participation active de chacun, Arprim s’engage à développer des alternatives aux stratégies conventionnelles de diffusion de l’art.
presentation_en: ARPRIM center printed art test aims to disseminate existing practices related to arts imprimés.Il addresses printed as an open media, mobile, social and accessible. It is defined as a test space and favorable experience in the development of a pluralistic vision of printed art. As a broadcaster of the art, ARPRIM proposes to act as intermediary between artists and the public and to facilitate contact with emerging practices related to printmaking. Building on the sharing of ideas and the active participation of everyone, ARPRIM is committed to developing alternatives to conventional strategies of dissemination of art.

presentation:
Art City is a not-for-profit community art studio dedicated to providing people of all ages with innovative and professional art programming, free of charge. Art City’s primary goal is to provide space and tools for anyone who wishes to express themselves creatively.Nearly two decades ago, Wanda Koop, an internationally renowned artist, saw a need for accessible arts programming in Winnipeg’s West Broadway neighbourhood. In 1998, she founded Art City, one of the first organizations of its kind in Canada. The idea: that community art programming should be accessible to all.
In 2006, Wanda Koop was made a Member of the Order of Canada in honour of her extraordinary contribution to Canadian art, and her dedication to community development through the arts.
Lieu d'exposition qui privilégie les productions in-situ et les collaborations avec d'autres structures.
presentation_en: An exhibition which focuses on in-situ productions and collaborations with other organizations.

presentation:
Ground is an artist-run space operated by visual artists Lito Kattou and Leontios Toumpouris.
Ground is an interdisciplinary platform open to all forms of artistic practice, willing to encourage dialogue and networking in the context of autonomy and symbiosis.

*DUUU est une webradio dédiée à la création contemporaine (www.duuuradio.fr). Fondée par des artistes en 2012, cet artist-run-space est né du désir de faire entendre des situations de réflexion et de travail. *DUUU élabore des programmes favorisant le partage d’expériences et révèle la pertinence de l’outil radiophonique pour produire des situations, expérimenter d’autres modes de parole, croiser des voix parallèles et susciter des rencontres.Archive vivante de la création contemporaine, la radio met en circulation un ensemble d’émissions qui s’inscrivent principalement dans le champ des arts visuels. *DUUU est à la fois un outil de production de situations radiophoniques, une archive sonore en mouvement, un panorama de la création contemporaine, et une plateforme accompagnant les artistes. Entre conversations, feuilletons, créations sonores, lectures, *DUUU réalise une collection de formats radiophoniques : un plan de travail, une exposition contée, le retour sur une première pièce, ForTune sur l’économie des artistes, le studio des écritures, une émission-bibliothèque...
presentation_en: * DUUU is an internet radio dedicated to contemporary creation (www.duuuradio.fr). Founded by artists in 2012, this artist-run-space is born from the desire to hear cases of reflection and work. * DUUU develops programs promoting the sharing of experiences and reveals the relevance of the tool to produce radio situations, experiment with other speech patterns, cross parallel voice and raise living rencontres.Archive of contemporary creation, radio circulates a set of programs that fall mainly in the field of visual arts. * DUUU is both a tool for production of radio situations, a sound archive in motion, a panorama of contemporary art and a platform accompanying artists. Between conversations, serials, sound creations, readings, * DUUU carries a collection of radio formats: a work plan, told an exposure, the return on a first piece of fortune on artists economy, studio writes, a program -library...

presentation:
Dos Mares encourage la mobilité et la visibilité des artistes à travers des programmes de résidences internationales. Les artistes sont accueillis en France, à Marseille et Paris pour une durée qui varie entre 1 et 3 mois. Ces résidences sont dédiées à la recherche durant lesquelles un ensemble d’intervenants re-questionnent les problématiques de l’artiste invité(e), sa démarche, son vocabulaire plastique, l'artiste doit repenser ses projets, affiner ses problématiques, dans un cadre propice aux rencontres, aux discussions.  Les artistes invités proviennent de toutes les régions du monde avec la particularité de côtoyer, dans leur vie ou leur travail, un territoire de forte densité de population ou habitant dans une grande métropole. Un réseau d'artistes est simultanément constitué afin de permettre à chaque résident de poursuivre la construction de son tissu artistique et social. 
Durant ces résidences l'artiste est accompagné(e) régulièrement par un ou plusieurs intervenants afin de ré-interroger sa pratique, de plonger dans des analyses sémantiques de sa démarche artistique, de dégager de nouvelles pistes de travail et d'élargir son champ d'action. A travers un travail de réflexion régulier nourrit de discussions souvent informelles l'artiste invité pourra ainsi faire une pause dans sa production artistique  pour repenser l'articulation des concepts qui alimentent ses propositions plastiques. Il ne sera pas question de produire une oeuvre en particulier ou d’exposer des oeuvres déjà produites mais bien de s’attarder sur la cohérence des concepts articulés par l’artiste, confronter l'ensemble de son travail passé et d'en dégager des potentialités. Une part du travail de résidence sera également dédié à la fabrication de tentatives de proposition, des expérimentations tendant à éprouver les axes de recherche, les valider ou les corriger.
Enfin Dos Mares s'emploie à développer de nouveaux modèles économiques, hybrides, permettant aux artistes de lier leurs domaines de compétence, leur expertise à une activité économique dont ils puissent bénéficier.
Dos Mares est une association française à but non lucratif basée à Marseille. Elle est fondée et dirigée par Ronald Reyes, artiste visuel originaire du Costa Rica, installé en France en 2013. En 2014, le programme de résidences croisées a été déclaré d'intérêt culturel par le Président et le Ministre de la Culture du Costa Rica.
presentation_en:
Dos Mares encourages mobility and visibility of artists through international residency programs. Artists are welcomed in France, Marseille and Paris for a period that varies between 1 and 3 months. These residences are dedicated to research, during which a range of stakeholders to re-question the guest artist's issues (e), his approach, his visual vocabulary, the artist needs to rethink its plans, refine its problems within a framework conducive to meetings, discussions. Guest artists are from all regions of the world with the particularity to rub in their life or work, a population density of territory or living in a big city. A network of artists is simultaneously formed to allow each resident to continue building its artistic and social fabric.
During these residences artist is accompanied (e) regularly by one or more stakeholders to re-examine its practice, diving into the semantic analysis of his artistic process, generate new avenues and expand its scope 'action. Through a working regular feeds often informal discussions reflect the guest artist will be able to take a break from his artistic production to rethink the articulation of concepts that feed its plastic proposals. It will not matter to produce a particular work or exhibit works already produced but to dwell on the consistency of concepts articulated by the artist confront all of his past work and to identify potential. Part of the residency work will also be dedicated to the manufacture proposal attempts, experiments designed to test the areas of research, validate or correct.
Finally Dos Mares is working to develop new business models, hybrids, allowing artists to link their areas of competence, expertise in economic activity from which they can benefit.
Dos Mares is a French non-profit based in Marseille. She founded and directed by Ronald Reyes, visual artist originally from Costa Rica, settled in France in 2013. In 2014, the cross-residence program was declared of cultural interest by the President and the Minister of Culture of Costa Rica.

presentation: El Mentidero is a home in downtown Bogotá. It is content and container-bucket and water at the same time. An exhibition space for non-productive merchandise, selling religious artifacts for non-believers, a set for unrelated relationships. Market without marketing. Use and disuse. One for all, all for one.Strategically located in its place, El Mentidero closes its doors to some and others and is inhabited by insatiable and problematic artists, masses eager of hay and poison, chefs with PhDs, broke students and broken teachers. Behind these doors a new school is being formed, without grades and without degrees but with toga and lots of class.

Spazio In Situ opened the 27th October 2017 presenting the exhibition What if?, that shows a work from each artist of the group. In Situ was spountaneously born by working togheter as a group, free from the critical-historical meaninig of the term “artistic group”, with the purpose of facing the complex role that artists have in our contemporary society, and in order to reach a higher level of artistic research. In Situ is more than a set of studios, it’s a studio devoted to the constant research of ideas, a place where personal growth meets the collective growth, an open-space without any walls between each artist studio. Artworks are free to live in the space, breathing an open-minded atmosphere that leads to a huge network of hyperlinks and unlimited possibilities.
In Situ constanly challenge himself re-thinking the space and its role, an example is the exhibition project Contemporary Absurdity, a six solo exhibitions cycle with works by Marco De Rosa, Roberta Folliero, Andrea Frosolini, Christophe Constantin, Francesco Palluzzi, Elisa Selli. The space during the exhibitions turns into a White Cube,  one time sacral space for every artwork that is inside, and now creating an ecosystem in which common objects become icons of a concpt, shifting the viewer from reality to illusion.Text by Sara Fiorelli
The 27th October 2018, Spazio In Situ celebrates two years togheter with the exhibition OUT OF SPACE, giving birth to Spazio In Più and welcoming other five artist studios (Sveva Angeletti, Federica Di Pietrantonio, Chiara Fantaccione, Daniele Sciacca, Guendalina Urbani).

Le Cube – independent art room est conçu comme un espace d’exposition, de résidence et de recherches axé sur les pratiques artistiques contemporaines. Sa démarche s’articule autour de projets soulevant des questionnements sociaux, culturels et politiques contextualisés, et encourage les propositions qui interrogent l’Histoire et les récits.Dans cette dynamique, Le Cube conçoit et développe un vaste programme d’expositions qui relient les problématiques artistiques à d’autres dimensions de la recherche, afin de mener une réflexion en constante évolution sur notre environnement. Lieu d’analyses et d’expérimentations, Le Cube défend une approche où les réflexions et les points de vue des artistes et des publics s’expriment.Dans une volonté de promouvoir les jeunes générations, Le Cube – independent art room a établi des programmes de résidences comme le new generation et le summer’s lab, qui accompagnent les artistes émergeants dans la conception et la production de leur travail artistique et de leur exposition. Par ailleurs, avec le programme curators zone, Le Cube – independent art room invite des commissaires d’expositions à dessiner de nouveaux récits et à réinterroger et repenser les systèmes d’exposition et de diffusion.Afin de prolonger de manière collective les sujets abordés par les expositions, Le Cube met en place des rencontres, conférences et soirées spéciales (talk, video night, séance d’écoute) qui créent des espaces inédits d’interaction critique et constituent le moyen d’inventer de nouvelles modalités d’un agir ensemble.Dans un même temps, afin d’aller à la rencontre de différents publics dans de nombreuses aires géographiques, Le Cube conçoit un programme hors les murs qui invite à la circulation des projets qu’il met en place et produit.Par ailleurs, Le Cube – independent art room suit plusieurs artistes marocains émergents sur le plus long terme en leur offrant un accompagnement administratif (aide dans la confection de dossiers artistiques, réponse à des appels à candidature, conception de textes, mise en réseau), réflexif (apports d’outils théoriques, rencontre avec des acteurs culturels et universitaires) et technique (production d’œuvres, évaluation des besoins, suivi avec les fournisseurs). Le Cube accorde également une place particulière aux artistes femmes dans sa programmation afin de compenser leur présence toujours inégale dans le paysage artistique.Toutes les activités du Cube donnent forme à une riche transversalité qui, en rendant poreuses les disciplines, permet d’explorer de nouveaux territoires, et crée une plateforme interdisciplinaire de dialogue et de rencontre pour les publics et les professionnels de tous milieux.
presentation_en: The Cube - independent art room is designed as an exhibition space, residential and research focused on contemporary art practices. His approach is based on projects that raise social questions, cultural and contextualized policies, and encourages proposals that question the history and récits.Dans this dynamic, poster designs and develops an extensive program of exhibitions that connect issues art to other dimensions of research, to conduct a constantly evolving reflection on our environment. Location analysis and experimentation, The Cube defends an approach where reflections and perspectives of artists and audiences expriment.Dans is a desire to promote the younger generations, The Cube - independent art room has established programs residences as new generation and the summer's lab, accompanying emerging artists in the design and production of their artistic work and exposure. Moreover, with the curators program area, Le Cube - independent art room invites curators to draw new stories and to re-examine and rethink the exposure systems and diffusion.Afin extend collectively the topics covered by exhibitions, poster sets up meetings, conferences and special events (talk, video night, listening session) that create novel spaces of critical interaction and are the means to invent new ways of acting together .In the same time, to go to meet different audiences in many geographic areas, poster design a program outside the walls that invites movement of projects it implements and produit.Par addition, the cube - independent art room follows several emerging Moroccan artists in the longer term by providing administrative support (help in making records ar tistics, response to calls for applications, text design, networking), reflexive (contributions of theoretical tools, meeting with cultural practitioners and academics) and technical (production of works, needs assessment, followed with suppliers ). The Cube also pays special attention to women artists in its programming in order to compensate them always unequal presence in the landscape artistique.Toutes Cube activities give shape to a rich cross which, by making porous disciplines, allows to explore new territories, and creates an interdisciplinary platform for dialogue and meeting for the public and professionals of all backgrounds.

presentation:
LES ATELIERS WONDER entre 2013 et 2016, se situent dans le berceau historique des piles WONDER au cœur des puces de St-Ouen (au 16 rue Marie Curie, 93400 ST-OUEN). Cette friche industrielle de 1700 m2, orpheline depuis la fermeture des usines Wonder en 1986, a été confiée en octobre 2013 à un jeune collectif d’artistes, sous une convention d’occupation, par l’entreprise Habitat 1964. Le collectif se compose essentiellement des 51 artistes travaillant sur le lieu. Cette friche industrielle qu’ils ont entièrement rénovée et rebâtie s’est petit à petit transformée en centre culturel évolutif.
Ces travaux ont permis de mettre à disposition, à moindre coût, des espaces de travail à de jeunes artistes émergents afin qu’ils bénéficient d’ateliers et de moyens de production. En effet, le coût d’un atelier en région parisienne est particulièrement élevé et difficile d’accès. Dans une volonté d’accessibilité, les cotisations par espace privatif pour les artistes résidents s’élèvent à 5€ le mètre carré, avec en contrepartie une implication dans l’évolution du projet.
presentation_en:
THE WONDER WORKSHOPS between 2013 and 2016, are located in the historic cradle of WONDER batteries in the heart of St. Ouen flea (at 16 rue Marie Curie, 93400 ST-OUEN). This brownfield 1700 m2, an orphan since the closure of factories Wonder in 1986, was given in October 2013 at a young collective of artists, under an occupancy agreement, the company Habitat 1964. The group consists mostly 51 artists working at the site. This industrial wasteland they have renovated and rebuilt was gradually transformed into evolving cultural center.
This work allowed to provide, at low cost, the young emerging artists workspaces so that they benefit from workshops and means of production. Indeed, the cost of a workshop in the Paris region is particularly high and difficult to access. In a commitment to accessibility, contributions by private space for resident artists amounted to € 5 per square meter, with a corresponding involvement in the evolution of the project.

presentation: Moving Art initiative F.L.O.A.T. is Amsterdam based artist's initiative which makes exhibitions from place to place. It focuses on proposing & composing short term art exhibitions/events, adapted to chosen theme and available space. F.L.O.A.T. arise from desire to share, shift and show not-well-known and/or rarely seen works of upcoming to mid-career artists, it searches to discover, contextualize and electrify the confines of audiovisual art. The policy of F.L.O.A.T, is to enable  artists to share their works with the broad audience around Europe and beyond, shed light on valuable works (mostly in the field of visual arts) that stay outside the mainstream of art world, discover places, spaces and people in thirst for art and culture, and activate them through the art practice. F.L.O.A.T. is nomadic art initiative and it's concept is to move from place to place and represent young and middle-career artists working in the field of moving picture.

Gallery 44 Centre for Contemporary Photography is a charitable, non-profit, artist-run centre committed to supporting multi-faceted approaches to photography and lens-based media. Founded in 1979 to establish a supportive environment for the development of artistic practice, Gallery 44’s mandate is to provide a context for meaningful reflection and dialogue on contemporary photography.
Gallery 44 is committed to programs that reflect the continuously changing definition of photography by presenting a wide range of practices that engage timely and critical explorations of the medium. Through exhibitions, public engagement, education programs and production facilities our objective is to explore the artistic, cultural, historic, social and political implications of the image in our ever-expanding visual world.

Fructôse, implantée depuis 2008 sur le môle 1 à Dunkerque, est une base de soutien aux artistes mais également un lieu de rencontres et de découvertes artistiques pluridisciplinaires.
L’association met à disposition ses bâtiments et ses compétences afin de favoriser la création et la diffusion artistique et émergente. Elle propose des ateliers de travail situés dans le hangar des Mouettes ainsi qu’un espace de création sonore et participe au développement des projets artistiques et professionnels des artistes venant de Dunkerque et d’ailleurs.
Fructôse est aussi un lieu de création et de diffusion ouvert à tous. L’association programme des résidences artistiques, un festival de performance et un salon de la petite édition, des concerts, des rencontres et des ateliers. Cette bulle effervescente est un projet solidaire.
Fructôse expérimente et interroge de nouvelles formes artistiques et de nouveaux rapports entre arts, territoires et habitants, tout en voulant contribuer à l’invention de nouvelles synergies pour faire face aux défis économiques, environnementaux et sociaux qui nous entourent.

FRUCTÔSEBASE EFFERVESCENT SUPPORT ARTISTESDUNKERQUE PORT INDUSTRIAL
Fructose, established since 2008 on the mole 1 in Dunkirk, is a base of support to artists but also a meeting place and multidisciplinary artistic discoveries.
The association provides its buildings and skills to promote the creation and dissemination of artistic and emerging. It offers workshops located in the hangar of Seagulls and an area of ​​sound creation and participates in the development of artistic projects and professional artists from Dunkirk and elsewhere.
Fructose is also a place of creation and diffusion open to all. The program association for artistic residencies, a performance festival and a small publishing salon, concerts, meetings and workshops. This effervescent bubble is a solidarity project.
Fructose experiences and questions of new artistic forms and new relationships between arts, territories and people, while wanting to contribute to the invention of new synergies to tackle the economic, environmental and social factors that surround us.

presentation: Institute for Provocation (IFP) is a Beijing based independent art organization and project space founded in 2010. Combining the study of theory and artistic practice, IFP aims to combine cross-disciplinary knowledge and stimulate cultural exchange and production in a collective approach. IFP organizes and advocates various kinds of activities, including artist residency, research project, discussion, exhibition making, workshop, publication, etc. on the basis of considering the dynamics of the relationship of independent art space with the society. Through a wide network of artists, researchers and makers in China and beyond, IFP can provide intelligence to incoming residents and collaborators who themselves become part of the network. We reckon the interaction between practice of residence artists and IFP’s institutional practice are constantly in a relationship of mutual provocation, friction and cooperation.

W s’est installé dans la banlieue Est de Paris, à Pantin en février 2010. L’espace possède deux potentiels bien différents: le premier niveau est un espace d’accrochage, le second un espace de travail. W vise la qualité des expressions et des rencontres. Nous avons créé un outil permettant de prendre des risques, un espace d'expérimentation indépendant. Des neuf artistes qui composent W, chacun construit une pratique singulière, et chacune de ces pratiques réclame impérieusement son siège. Le projet est vivant parce qu'il fait travailler ensemble des méthodes et des modèles différents. Les membres ne se font pas la même idée de ce qu'est leur association et c'est leurs initiatives mises en commun qui lui donne forme. Ces ambitions sont le creuset de la conception d’expositions soutenant des questions précises élaborées au fil des discussions du groupe incluant aussi des personnalités extérieures, critiques d’art, théoriciens, amis.
presentation_en: W settled in the eastern suburbs of Paris, Pantin in February 2010. The space has two very different potential: the first level is an attachment area, the second a workspace. W is the quality of expression and meetings. We have created a tool to take risks, an independent testing space. Of the nine artists that make up W, each built a singular practice and each practice imperiously demanded her seat. The project is alive because he is working together methods and different models. Members do not make the same idea of ​​what their association and it is their pooled initiatives that give it form. These ambitions are the crucible of exhibit design supporting specific issues developed over the group's discussions also including external experts, art critics, theorists, friends.

presentation: 221A is a non-profit artist-run centre that presents exhibitions, talks, publications and special projects that explore the role of design in the shaping of contemporary societies.

Le 3e impérial est un centre voué à l’exploration des potentiels de l’art actuel dans les sphères du quotidien et les espaces non dédiés à l’art. Ses activités — recherche, création, production, diffusion, édition, forums de réflexion — s’articulent autour d’un programme de résidence en art infiltrant qui vise à féconder les rapports artistes/publics et à valoriser les liens entre la pratique artistique, l’espace public et l’engagement social.
presentation_en: The 3rd Imperial is a center dedicated to the exploration potential of the art in the spheres of everyday life and not dedicated to art spaces. Its activities - research, creation, production, distribution, publishing, discussion forums - are organized around an infiltrating art residency program to fertilize the artist / public relations and enhance the links between artistic practice, the public space and social commitment.

presentation: The Aboriginal Curatorial Collective / Collectif des Conservateurs Autochtones (ACC/CCA) is a national arts service organization that supports, promotes and advocates on behalf of Canadian and international Aboriginal curators, critics, artists and representatives of arts and cultural organizations. The ACC/CCA develops and disseminates curatorial practices, innovative research and critical discourses on Aboriginal arts and culture. By fostering collaboration and exchange, the ACC/CCA builds an equitable space for the Aboriginal intellectual and artistic community.

aceartinc. is an artist-run centre dedicated to the development, exhibition and dissemination of contemporary art. aceartinc. maintains a commitment to emerging artists and recognizes its role in placing contemporary artists in a larger cultural context. aceartinc. encourages applications from all contemporary artists and curators.

English bellowAction Art Actuel (AAA) est un centre d’artistes qui se consacre à la promotion et au développement des pratiques en art actuel. Actif depuis 30 ans dans la région de Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu au Québec (Montérégie), AAA agit comme lieu de diffusion et de soutien à la recherche en présentant le travail d’artistes d’ici et d’ailleurs.AAA offre un environnement stimulant de recherche, de présentation et d’expérimentation où artistes émergents et établis se succèdent à travers une programmation d’expositions, d’événements et de résidences. Le centre compte une vaste salle d’exposition, un atelier-résidence.AAA est un centre d’artistes en pleine mouvance, alimenté par un fonctionnement organique qui propose différentes plates-formes de diffusion, de recherche, de promotion et de production d’œuvres pluridisciplinaires. Plusieurs initiatives et activités satellites sont menées en parallèle à la programmation d’expositions, tel que l’édition de publications, l’organisation de formations et la tenue d’activités de médiation avec le public. De nombreuses collaborations sont également initiées par le biais de projets de commissariats.--AAA is devoted to the promotion and development of contemporary art. For 30 years, AAA has been active in supporting and presenting the work of artists from here and abroad.AAA offers a stimulating environment for research, experimentation, presentation and dialogue in which both emerging and established artists can participate through a program of exhibitions, events and residencies. The centre has one large exhibition space, a studio with residence.AAA is a dynamic artist-run centre, sustained by a smoothly run administrative directive and a clear mandate. Several initiatives and satellite activities are carried out in parallel with the exhibition program, such as workshops and public outreach programs. Some collaborations are also initiated through curated projects.

AdMare promeut l’art actuel aux Îles-de-la-Madeleine. 
Avec une programmation régulière d’expositions individuelles et collectives, des résidences, des événements artistiques d’envergure et des projets de publication, AdMare offre aux artistes un espace de ressourcement, d’exploration, d’échange et de réflexion en relation avec le territoire et la communauté dans laquelle il opère.
presentation_en:
AdMare promotes contemporary art in Îles-de-la-Madeleine.
With regular programming of solo and group exhibitions, residencies, art events and major publishing projects, AdMare offers artists a healing space, exploration, exchange and reflection in relation to the territory and the community in which it operates.

presentation: L’Atelier de l’Île is an artist-run centre that promotes research, experimentation and production in contemporary printmaking.

The Annapolis Region Community Arts Council (ARCAC) is a registered non-profit, charitable, community organization dedicated to encouraging and promoting the arts. Located in the beautiful Annapolis Valley, Nova Scotia; a place that artists seem to be naturally drawn to, ARCAC was founded by a group of artists in 1982. They began meeting in Annapolis Royal to explore ways of sharing their work and ideas with one another and with the community at large. They felt that if art was to survive as living cultural force, artists should take the first step toward demystifying the practice of art.ARCAC has developed a province-wide and national reputation for being able to generate interesting activities and opportunities within the community. Our membership currently comprises over 200 individuals and families who believe that involvement in the arts makes life both rewarding and fun. We run a year round schedule of workshops, classes, concerts,"coffee house" evenings, readings, slide shows, talks and special events. Through our Scholarship Fund, we assist students of all ages who wish to pursue art-related courses of study.ARTsPLACE Artist-run Centre is run by an Exhibitions Committee of the ARCAC Board, comprised 100% of artists, to support and encourage serious artistic endeavours at all levels and of all sorts. Our exhibition schedule has been designed to reflect the role ARCAC plays as intermediary between the contemporary art world out there and the local community. ARTsPLACE is funded in-part by the Canada Council for the Arts, the Province of Nova Scotia and fundraising endeavours.

Alberta Printmakers (A/P) is a non-profit, artist-run centre founded in 1989 in Calgary, Alberta. The organization’s goals are to increase public awareness of print media, to engage a diverse audience and to provide resources for the artistic community and production facilities for printmaking.
A/P has an open membership and is governed by a board of directors. Management and administration of A/P’s activities are the responsibility of its Funding and Communications Director and its Gallery and Studio Director. A/P also hosts a summer student program, as well as a residency program.

Founded in 2003, Arnica Artist-Run Centre Society is a not-for-profit gallery that provides a supportive environment for emerging contemporary artists. Arnica received charitable status in 2008 and is part of a Canada-wide network of artist run centres.Arnica provides exhibition space for contemporary art that is dynamic, innovative and thoughtful. It also serves as a space for artists to research and develop new work and helps emerging artists in our city, adding to the cultural mix of Kamloops.

Artexte est une bibliothèque et un centre d’exposition en art contemporain, avec une collection unique de plus de 27 000 publications couvrant divers aspects des arts visuels. Plus de 80% des acquisitions proviennent de dons de la communauté artistique.
presentation_en: Artexte is a library and an exhibition center for contemporary art with a unique collection of over 27 000 publications covering various aspects of the visual arts. Over 80% of acquisitions come from donations to the arts community.

presentation: AKA supports the creation and development of artist driven initiatives and emerging practices that speak to, reflect and encourage dialogue in our culturally diverse communities. This includes work in all media by local, national and international artists. Our venues consist of a street-level gallery, billboard and multi-use screening and performance event space; we also source off-site locations for site-specific projects.  We are committed to acting as a centre for risk-taking and artistic self-determination produced by a diversity of voices; engaging in critical discourse and intersections with related cultural practices.

articule’s programming aims to provoke dialogue, to foster critical thinking and to promote a diversity of practices and experiences in the artistic and social realms. We are open to all disciplines, and present exhibitions and action- and research-based works. articule curates events, such as screenings and forums, to explore specific themes or artistic practices. Our flexible short-term programming, known as Special Projects, answers to the time-sensitive needs and initiatives of artists as they arise. This programming channel pays particular attention to “undisciplined” practices and projects that manifest themselves in site-specific contexts or alternative locations. articule provides critical writings, as well as a program of discussions, conferences and workshops to encourage exchanges between artists and the public. Recognizing the importance of community and knowledge-sharing, we initiate and participate in numerous collaborative projects with other artist-run centres and community organizations. Through our engaging programming, we offer a fertile space for creativity, both to our organization and a diverse public.

presentation: Art Metropole is a not-for-profit organisation with a focus on the production, dissemination and contextualisation of artist-initiated publication in any media, especially those formats and practices predisposed to sharing and circulation.

Founded in 1982, Artcite Inc. is southwestern Ontario’s only incorporated, registered charitable, non-profit artist-run centre, founded, directed and managed by practicing professional artists in various disciplines. Dedicated exclusively to expanding the visibility of contemporary arts within our region and advancing the professional presentation, promotion and animation of contemporary art forms, Artcite maintains a balanced and diverse program of events, including: ten or more gallery and off-site exhibitions and site installations by Canadian and international artists; guest artist lectures, workshops and residencies; screenings of experimental film and video art; experimental music and audio; multi-disciplinary performances and special projects, including our annual, community-wide MayWorks Labour Arts Festival; our biennial, off-site Fahrenheit Festival of fire sculpture and performance; our Free 4 All Walls international street art mural project; our monthly Stitch ‘n’ Bitch and Artist Trading Cards sessions; and public readings by Canadian and international authors and poets.
Located in the heart of Windsor’s downtown core (and only three minutes from the greater metropolitan Detroit area), Artcite’s highly visible, partially bisected storefront gallery space is particularly well suited to solo, two-person and group exhibitions, as well as installations that make full use of the gallery space and windows, and are politically or socially engaged.

Imago est un centre de production voué au développement et à la diffusion de l’estampe et de l’art imprimé. Le centre offre un lieu de recherche, un atelier fonctionnel et une programmation qui reflète les tendances actuelles en arts visuels. En plus d’offrir un laboratoire de création et d’expérimentation à travers son programme d’artistes en résidence, ses conférences d’artistes, ses ateliers, ses expositions et ses projets de création interdisciplinaires, Imago encourage et appui des artistes de différentes disciplines à explorer les possibilités de l’estampe.The mandate of Atelier d’estampe Imago is to facilitate, promote and disseminate creation in the fields of printmaking and printed art.As a production centre engaged in the development, creation and dissemination of print and printed art, Imago offers a space for research and a program that reflects contemporary trends in the visual arts. The centre offers a program of artist residencies, lectures by artists, workshops, exhibitions and interdisciplinary creative projects.The studio owns a 16 1/2 x 34 inch Griffin 000 press, a 28 x 46 inch Westman and Baker lithography press and a 40 x 70 inch Charles Brand press, and is equipped for water-based screenprinting, large-format relief and intaglio, and water-free lithography.
presentation_en: Imago is a production center dedicated to the development and dissemination of printmaking and printed art. The center offers a place of research, a functional workshop and programming that reflects current trends in visual arts. In addition to offering a creative laboratory and experimentation through its artists in residence program, its artist talks, workshops, exhibitions and interdisciplinary creation projects, Imago encourage and support artists from different disciplines to explore the possibilities of estampe.The mandate of Imago printmaking workshop is to Facilitate, promote and Disseminate establishment in the fields of printmaking and printed art.As is production center engaged in the development, creation and dissemination of print and printed art, Imago offers a space for research and a program That Reflects contemporary trends in the visual arts. presentation: Presse Papier is an artist-run centre dedicated to contemporary printmaking. Located in Trois-Rivières, near the St. Lawrence River, the studio offers professional artists a production context conducive to research, creation and dissemination. Recognized for its openness, professionalism and the quality of its members’ production, Presse Papier facilitates the development of major projects by artists from here and abroad.

ARTSPACE (est. 1974) is Peterborough’s artist-run centre, a non-profit organization committed to the presentation of contemporary art and the support of artists. We change in response to the needs of artists, and work to engage and develop audiences. Our programming, though national in scope, is regional in spirit. By connecting artists to the community and welcoming a broad range of involvement, we continue to attract respected talent from across the country—talent we are proud to compensate with fees that often exceed recommended CARFAC rates.

Artspeak was founded in 1986 by curator Cate Rimmer, artist Keith Higgins and writer Jeff Derksen. Our early association with the Kootenay School of Writing served to situate Artspeak within a unique interdisciplinary community of visual artists, writers and critics. Artspeak is operated by artists from the visual and language arts who share concerns in relation to the theory and practice of contemporary art. The mandate of the gallery is to exhibit contemporary art and to encourage a dialogue between visual art and writing. Of particular interest is work that crosses the boundaries between the two disciplines, exploring their common areas of praxis—a distinct aspect of the history of cultural practice in this region.
Artspeak has played a significant role in addressing the historical, social and intellectual conditions of contemporary visual and language arts production from the West Coast. We aim to support the practices of emerging and established artists and writers from this region and beyond by providing opportunities to exhibit, publish and present new work to enthusiastic audiences. Artspeak actively contributes to cultural communities through our commitment to artists producing challenging, innovative work in diverse media, our affiliation with like-minded organizations and the public interest we generate in contemporary art.

Fondé en 1982, l’Atelier Circulaire est un centre d’artistes voué à la création, à la recherche, à la production et à la diffusion en arts imprimés. L’Atelier Circulaire soutient le travail des artistes en estampe contemporaine en encourageant l’emploi des techniques traditionnelles et des nouvelles technologies.Atelier Circulaire, founded in 1982, is an artist-run centre devoted to creation, research, dissemination and education with a focus on print media. Its mandate is to preserve and teach traditional printmaking techniques, while integrating new technologies and contemporary print practices.
Atelier Circulaire’s programs and services are geared to both professional artists and the general public. It provides a workspace and specialized equipment for intaglio, lithography, engraving and digital printing. The centre welcomes artists-in-residence, organizes gallery exhibitions and conferences, and offers demonstrations, specialized courses and training in printmaking.

presentation:
L’Atelier Silex, organisme à but non lucratif, est né en 1983 du désir de regroupement de jeunes artistes sculpteurs sur pierre et sur bois fraîchement diplômés du Baccalauréat en arts plastiques de l’Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières. Évoluant avec ses membres et leur pratique artistique, l’Atelier Silex se dote graduellement d’équipements d’ateliers de production de pierre, de bois, de métal, de céramique et verre et de résine et devient propriétaire de ses locaux en 1987.Dans les années 90, le regroupement s’équipe d’une salle d’exposition, l’Espace 0…3/4, qui lui permet d’accueillir des activités favorisant la recherche, la diffusion et la production. Une résidence d’artiste est ajoutée en 1997 offrant la possibilité de recevoir des artistes de différentes disciplines, de régions et de pays étrangers. En 2005-2006, l’Atelier Silex remet à neuf la fenestration et rénove l’ensemble de sa bâtisse pour une remise aux normes. Au printemps-été 2008, l’Atelier Silex célèbre son 25e anniversaire et clôture ses événements par une exposition de ses membres à la salle Raymond-Lasnier de la Maison de la culture de Trois-Rivières. La période 2006-2009 est marquée par un mouvement des ressources humaines : un nouveau coordonnateur est embauché et le conseil d’administration se renouvelle. L’Atelier Silex procède ensuite à une restructuration administrative qui mènera à l’élaboration d’un plan stratégique actuellement en cours de réalisation.
Au fil des ans, l’Atelier Silex est devenu un centre d’artistes en arts visuels de tout premier ordre par sa situation géographique avantageuse au cœur de Trois-Rivières et à mi-chemin entre Montréal et Québec. De plus, l’Atelier Silex offre six-cents mètres carrés d’ateliers de production et deux cents mètres carrés de salles dédiées à la diffusion, la recherche et la mise en situation. Par ailleurs, la qualité de ses partenariats et l’expertise de ses membres ajoutent désormais des atouts complémentaires au fonctionnement du centre. L’expertise technique et conceptuelle des membres de l’Atelier Silex quant aux réalisations et aux réflexions sur l’intégration de l’œuvre d’art dans l’espace public est sans contredit un des points forts du centre. Cette expertise, reconnue par la communauté artistique, soutient et contribue à la recherche sculpturale au sein de l’atelier et de la communauté artistique et culturelle.
presentation_en:
Atelier Silex, non-profit organization, was born in 1983 the young sculptors grouping desire stone and recently graduated Baccalaureate wood in fine arts from the Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières. Evolving with its members and their artistic practice, Silex Workshop gradually acquires equipment of stone production workshops, wood, metal, ceramic and glass and resin and becomes the owner of its premises 1987.Dans the 90, the grouping is acquiring a showroom, Space 0 ... 3/4, which allows it to host activities promoting research, dissemination and production. An artist residency was added in 1997 with the possibility of receiving artists from different disciplines, regions and foreign countries. In 2005-2006, Atelier Silex refurbishing the windows and renovating all of its building for up to standard. In spring-summer 2008, the famous Atelier Silex its 25th anniversary and closing events with an exhibition of its members at the Raymond-Lasnier room of the House of Culture in Trois-Rivières. The 2006-2009 period was marked by a human resources movement: a new coordinator is hired and the board is renewed. The Silex Workshop then proceeds to an administrative restructuring that will lead to the development of a strategic plan currently being implemented.
Over the years, Atelier Silex has become a visual arts center artists of the first order by its advantageous geographical location in the heart of Trois-Rivières and midway between Montreal and Quebec. In addition, Silex Workshop offers six hundred square meters of production workshops and two hundred square meters of rooms dedicated to the dissemination, research and development situation. Moreover, the quality of its partnerships and expertise of its members now add complementary assets to the operation of the center. The technical and design expertise of Silex Workshop about the achievements and reflections on the integration of the work of art in public space is undoubtedly one of the highlights of the center. This expertise is recognized by the artistic community, supports and contributes to the sculptural research at the workshop and the artistic and cultural community.

presentation: Situé dans une ancienne Fraternité franciscaine, dans le centre historique de la cathédrale de Limoges, IF, l'Irrésistible Fraternité est lieu dédié à la jeune création, l’art contemporain et au design à Limoges inauguré en mai 2016. Il accueille un collectif de jeunes designers et plasticiens, membres de l’association .748 qui assure la direction artistique du lieu, ainsi que studio de création Yocto. IF développe sa propre programmation culturelle privilégiant la jeune création et  le lien citoyen. Conçu comme un espace de vie et de passage, IF aborde la création comme  une manière d’habiter le monde, aujourd’hui plus incertain, plus complexe, qu’hier et devant se nourrir de moyens plus frugaux et partagés. IF veut conduire, en réinterrogeant le territoire, son patrimoine, ses savoir-faire et ses acteurs, des réflexions sur la conduite de l’art dans des espaces nouveaux ou/et revendiqués comme tels . Se faisant, IF entend s’agréger visions extérieures le temps d’une résidence sur le champ du design d’espace et de l’architecture.IF fait le pari d’offrir des temps de recherche pour imaginer et réfléchir sur les notions d’espace, d’agencement urbain et/ou de paysages en lien avec le réseau régional d’art contemporain, en particulier le réseau Cinq 25.
presentation_en: Located in a former Franciscan Fraternity, in the historic center of the cathedral of Limoges, IF, the Brotherhood is irresistible place dedicated to young artists, contemporary art and design in Limoges opened in May 2016. It hosts a collective young designers and artists, members of the association that .748 is the artistic director of the location and design studio Yocto. IF developing its own cultural programming favoring young artists and citizens link. Designed as a living space and passage, IF addresses creation as a way of inhabiting the world today, more uncertain, more complex than yesterday and before eating more frugal ways and shared. IF wants to drive in réinterrogeant territory, its heritage, its expertise and its actors, reflections on the conduct of the art in new spaces and / or claimed as such. In doing so, IF intends to aggregate external time visions of a residence on the space design field and architecture.IF is betting offer research time to think and reflect on the notions of space, urban layout and / or in connection with the regional landscape of contemporary art network, in particular the network Five 25.

presentation: GOSWELL ROAD was set-up on the 29th November 2016 by artist duo Ruiz Stephinson (www.ruizstephinson.com) in their atelier. Every six weeks they clear the atelier completely and invite an artist, offering them an exhibition and a publication. presentation: Paradise est un projet artistique, c’est le seul lieu à Nantes dédié aux résidences d’artistes nationaux et internationaux. Il est composé de deux appartements, d’un atelier, d’un lieu d’exposition et d’une cour intérieure. C’est un lieu singulier et unique à Nantes. C’est le fruit d’une aventure et de passions humaines entre deux architectes Agnès Lambot et Philippe Barré architectes et mécènes de Paradise et de deux artistes plasticiens Béatrice Dacher et Michel Gerson. Paradise c’est mettre à disposition des artistes résidents : une bourse de recherche, un appartement, un atelier et un lieu d’exposition de 100 m2. Véritable lieu de recherches, d’expérimentations et de monstrations, Paradise propose un cycle de 5 à 6 résidences d’artistes par an où l’enjeu est de créer et d’exposer, dans une dynamique d’échanges avec le public.
presentation_en: Paradise is an art project, this is the only place in Nantes dedicated to national and international artists in residence. It consists of two apartments, a workshop, an exhibition space and a courtyard. It is a singular and unique place in Nantes. It is the fruit of an adventure and human passions between two architects Lambot Agnes and Philippe Paradise Barre architects and patrons and two visual artists Dacher Beatrice and Michael Gerson. Paradise is to provide resident artists: a fellowship, an apartment, a workshop and an exhibition space of 100 m2. True place of research, experiments and demonstrations, Paradise offers a 5- to 6 artist residencies per year where the challenge is to create and display in a dynamic interaction with the public.

presentation:
C’est en 2017 qu’apparaît Mutatio, espace d’exposition d’art contemporain indépendant situé à Nantes. Aménagé au cœur des entrepôts Delrue, le lieu se développe à bas bruit dans l’ancienne friche d’artistes vouée à la disparition. Impulsé par Jean-Baptiste Janisset, cet artist-run space est une initiative privée. La mise à disposition d’une partie de la surface d’un atelier de travail est née du désir d’accompagner des artistes émergents sous la forme d’invitations. Ces cartes blanches sont autant de propositions de réappropriation et d’expérimentation dans lesquelles le rôle du dialogue est central. A la croisée des chemins entre plusieurs pratiques artistiques, Mutatio tient autant du relais que l’on trouvait le long des voies romaines dans l’Antiquité que d’un phénomène d’altération au contact des contraintes spatiales et des échanges entre artistes. Envisagé comme un interstice ouvert pour ceux qui ont besoin, le dispositif souhaite aussi faire rebond pour chaque trajectoire artistique. Le protocole d’invitation suppose d’investir un espace de 13 m 2 et de 3,5 mètres de hauteur par le volume et la couleur en le travaillant comme un environnement plastique. Chaque intervention fraye une voie alternative au white cube, condition de visibilité à l’histoire récente et peut-être non définitive. Au vide majestueux des lieux institutionnels, Mutatio substitue un espace bringuebalant, à bricoler, au rythme de la création en train de se faire. Les propositions varient les temps de résidence, de production et d’exposition selon le tempo de chaque artiste.
Texte, Ilan Michel
presentation_en:
It was in 2017 appears Mutatio, contemporary art exhibition space independent located in Nantes. Set in the heart of Delrue warehouses, where develops low noise in the former wasteland artists doomed to extinction. Boosted by Jean-Baptiste Janisset, this artist-run space is a private initiative. The provision of a portion of the surface of a workshop arose from the desire to support emerging artists in the form of invitations. These white boards are all proposals reappropriation and experimentation in which the role of dialogue is central. At the crossroads of several artistic practices, is as much Mutatio relay that was found along the Roman road in ancient times as a phenomenon of alteration in contact with space constraints and exchanges between artists. Considered as an open gap for those in need, the device also wishes to rebound for each artistic trajectory. The invitation protocol means investing a space of 13 m 2 and 3.5 meters high by the volume and color in the working environment as a plastic. Each operation spawning an alternative route to the white cube, visibility condition in recent history and maybe not final. Vacuum majestic institutional places Mutatio substitutes a rickety space to tinker, to the rhythm of creation in the making. The proposals vary the residence time, production and exhibition at the tempo of each artist.
Text Ilan Michel

presentation: L’in.plano, association loi 1901, est une plateforme de recherches et de production qui a pour mission la diffusion et la valorisation de la création contemporaine sur un principe de mutualisation des savoirs et des équipements. Le Studio Delta est situé au 158 rue Pierre de Roubaix dans une ancienne usine de textile du centre ville, dans la continuité  de l’avenue des Nations Unies, à deux rues de l’Espace Croisé, centre d’art vidéo; mais également des différents acteurs culturels du quartier du Pile réunis autour de la Parcelle Collective.
Bâtiment  de 1930, il est de construction industrielle en béton et brique du nord. Son toit en sheds offre des espaces lumineux soutenus par une structure métallique en poutres Eiffel . Construit sur deux niveaux, un rez-de-chaussée et un premier étage, il dispose d’un monte-charge. Au rdc, 5 ateliers d’artistes sur 210 m² qui communiquent vers un atelier aux machines de 35 m². Le studio dispose également d’un atelier d’encadrements dans un espace de 140 m² Le premier étage de 410 m² accueille un espace d’exposition associatif destiné à la promotion de la jeune création française sur le territoire de la Métropole Lilloise; mais aussi un espace dédié aux artistes accueillis en résidence.
Le Studio Delta a pour objet la mise en place d’événements artistiques qui favorisent l’expérimentation et la recherche de nouvelles formes de création. Il puise ses racines dans l’énergie des acteurs artistiques engagés de la région Nord de France. Le studio cherche à mettre en réseau artistes et initiatives culturelles et, au travers de manifestations ponctuelles, à partager son engagement  auprès du public Nordiste. Expositions, ateliers culturels, échanges avec les partenaires tels que écoles d’arts, les galeries, mais également son réseau d’Artist Run Space sont au programme.

presentation_en: THE KABINET is a place of artistic encounters, alternative and independent. Founded in 2013, the space aims to discover and confront multiple artistic practices.
